name: chamomile
contraindications: allergy to Asteraceae family; caution with strong anticoagulants
safety_notes: generally safe as tea; rare allergic reactions reported in sensitive individuals

name: peppermint
contraindications: reflux or heartburn (large doses); avoid strong oil in infants; caution in early pregnancy with excessive use
safety_notes: tea generally safe; concentrated oil can cause side effects if overused

name: lavender
contraindications: pregnancy and young children (high-dose oil); known allergy
safety_notes: aromatic use and tea are usually well tolerated at modest doses

name: lemon balm
indications: nervous tension; mild insomnia; stress-related digestive issues
safety_notes: traditionally safe short-term; may have mild sedative effects

name: ginger
contraindications: high-dose use with anticoagulant therapy; high doses late in pregnancy
safety_notes: culinary amounts safe; medicinal doses should be limited in bleeding disorders

name: fennel
indications: gas; bloating; infant colic (via breastfeeding mother); mild digestive discomfort
contraindications: hormone-sensitive conditions; infants (strong preparations); known allergy
safety_notes: tea usually safe in small amounts; avoid strong extracts in very young infants
